Title: 13309R Demolition & Associated Works At Tower Ballroom Reservoir Road, Edgbaston, Birmingham, B16 9EE - AWARD
Description:
13309R - Demolition and Associated Works at Former Tower Ballroom, Reservoir Road, Edgbaston, Birmingham 16 9EE
      
      Acivico Building Consultancy Ltd on behalf of Birmingham City Council invites tenders for the demolition of the former Tower Ballroom, Reservoir Road, Edgbaston, Birmingham 16 9EE
      
      The works comprise of the demolition, general site clearance and removal of asbestos containing materials.  The site must be well secured by use of appropriate fencing during and at the end of the contract.
      
      The contract will be for a duration of 12 weeks, with anticipated start date of  26th September 2022. 
      
      The contract will be awarded to a single supplier.
      
      The Council will be using its free to use e-tendering system (in-tend) for the administration of this procurement process and potential suppliers must register with the system to be able to express an interest. If you wish to express an interest in this opportunity, please click on the following link to access https://in-tendhost.co.uk/birminghamcc/ and submit your details to register. You will then be sent details on how to log on which will enable you to download all relevant tender documentation.  
      
      If you are unable to register with In-tend or have any questions or problems on how to use this web site please either email us at: cps@birmingham.gov.uk. 
      
      Requests to participate must be by way of completion and return of the tender documentation no later than 12 noon on  29 July 2022 using the Supplier Portal. 
      
      Site Visits:
      
      It is recommended that potential suppliers may wish to undertake a site visit to ascertain the existing conditions that could affect the demolition process and make sure that their tender price is sufficient to carry out the project safely. It is however a recommendation not a condition of the tender, therefore and if a potential supplier wishes to visit the site then they should read the following information and act on it accordingly. 
      
      Open day has been assigned to view the site and buildings which will take place on Wednesday 20th July 2022 between 9:00 am and 12 noon.
      
      Contractors who wish to view the site must register their intentions by the correspondence function on the Council's Intend Portal by 4pm - Monday 18th July 2022.
      
      A time slot will be allocated on a first come, first serve basis and the potential supplier's representatives must not arrive before their pre-selected time allocation. THERE WILL BE NO FURTHER OPPORTUNITY TO INTERNALLY INSPECT THE SITE. 
      
      A maximum of three persons per potential supplier will be allowed to enter the building and must adhere to all government guidelines including social distancing and the current Site Operating Procedures. The maximum time allocated is 20 minutes inside the building. The potential supplier's representatives will be required to sign in and provide contact details (mobile numbers) whilst on site. No hand wash facilities are on site and e...

Title: Play Area Resurfacing
Description:
Two elements of the work follow.

Medstead Parish Council (near Alton) Hampshire has an enclosed play area for younger children. The current play area surfacing is now sinking in many places due to poor initial installation and requires replacing in its entirety. Specification as follows:
i. Enclosed Play Area (approx 240sqm): - To remove and dispose of existing rubber mulch surfacing. Dig out and lay a sub base of compacted MOT type 1 to a minimum of 50mm. Lay new Tiger Mulch (colour to be confirmed).

Medstead Parish Council also has a separate adult gym equipment area and the matting is becoming worn and a trip hazard and requires the following work. 
ii. Adult Gym Equipment:- To overlay existing grass matting with new rubber mats around each piece of equipment (six items) and extending the area currently covered to help avoid further erosion. Repair the worn soil levels using top soil and seed as required. 

Price to include all labour and materials required to carry out the work. VAT (if applicable) to be quoted separately.

INSURANCE
The Contractor shall hold Employers Liability and Public Liability insurance to the cover of a minimum of £5,000,000. A copy of the insurance document must be lodged with the Clerk to the Council before any works commence.

Applications for the above work (Closing date 9th September 2022) to: - 
Mr Peter Baston, Clerk to the Council, PO Box 343, Alton, Hampshire, GU34 9JS. 
Email: clerk@medsteadpc.org
Tel: 07908-932472. 
www.medsteadpc.org

Title: Young People Supported Accommodation Services - 18+ Shared Accommodation
Description:
Our Vision is that every child and young person in Oxfordshire should have access to a full range of housing services and the opportunity for a decent and affordable home suitable to their needs; and that vulnerable families should be enabled to live in safe and suitable housing as a basis for supportive family relationships and thriving communities.

The Objectives of the YPSA are for Young People:
• To be in accommodation suitable for their needs
• To be supported to maintain their accommodation appropriately
• To feel safe and are protected from harm
• To engage in education, employment and training
• To be supported to live healthier lives
• To be equipped with the skills necessary to live independently.
• To be supported to prevent homelessness / reoccurrence of
homelessness
• To be supported to build appropriate and positive relationships and links
to their local communities and family members (where it is safe)
• To be moved on in a planned manner, without reoccurrence of
homelessness

The County Council has a statutory duty to provide housing and support for the following vulnerable young people:
• Looked After (LAC) and Leaving Care aged 16 to 18 years or up to 24 years in some circumstances.
• Unaccompanied Asylum-Seeking Children (UASC) aged 16 and 17 years.
• UASC of 18 to 21 years with no recourse to public funds subject to a Human Rights assessment.
• Young people who are homeless aged 16 and 17 years.
• Young people remanded through the youth justice system aged 16 and 17 years.

This project is specifically for 18+ shared accommodation. OCC are seeking a suitable supplier to provide intensive support and accommodation for young people who are assessed as able to live with others given appropriate support. This will be the large majority of young people entering commissioned YPSA services.

Title: Bedfordshire Employment and Skills Service MULTIPLY Provision CBC-0961-DPS-LS-BESS-15 - AWARD
Description:
The Bedfordshire Employment and Skills Service has, subject to funding, commissioned provision which will form part of Central Bedfordshire and Bedford Borough Councils' response to the Government's Multiply programme for the remainder of the 2022-23 financial year and the full 2023-24 and 2024-25 financial years.  
      
      Multiply is a government initiative which is providing local authorities with the funding required to target adults aged 19+ who have not attained a Level 2 or above maths qualification.
      The overall objective of the Multiply programme is to increase the levels of functional numeracy in the adult population across the UK with outcomes that include:
      More adults achieving maths qualifications through accredited courses
      An increase in participation in numeracy courses
      Improved labour market outcomes e.g.. fewer numeracy skills gaps reported by employers, and an increase in the proportion of adults that progress into sustained employment and / or education
      Increased adult numeracy across the population with greater confidence in everyday maths skills

The aim is to build on existing data collection to create a methodology for measuring available skills, identifying shortages, and forecasting demand in a specified region. Title: EV076 29. Energy Battery Storage Units
Description:
Energy Battery Storage Units for EV076 Operational Depot Accommodation Project / The Killingworth Sustainable Retrofit Project

The Authority has secured funding from the European Regional Development Fund (ERDF) to support delivery of the Killingworth Site Sustainable Retrofit Project. This project is a combination of refurbishment and replacement of existing office accommodation, workshop, welfare and other facilities on the site ensuring it 'future proofs' depot operations. Energy efficiency and functionality are key principles, and the Project will use a wide range of energy efficient, generation and storage/distribution solutions to support a move to an electric powered operational fleet whilst reducing the site carbon footprint. This procurement opportunity relates specifically to Block F Vehicle Maintenance Workshop Refurbishment and North Tyneside Council will act as Principal Contractor for the project, therefore tenderers should note that they will be working in the capacity of Sub-Contractor. Tenderers must be aware that this is an operational building and as such works must be undertaken taking into consideration the ongoing workshop operations which will require work phasing and innovative delivery solutions to ensure disruption to the service is kept to a minimum. We expect tenderers to liaise closely with the service and out of hours and weekend working will at times be necessary. The Block F site is very restrictive for access / plant movements and therefore it is strongly recommended that Tenderers undertake a site visit, contact details to make arrangements are contained within the Preambles document in the tender pack. This package is anticipated to be completed in 6 weeks. The whole scheme is to be completed during the period 01/04/2023 to 31/05//2023 (provisional).

Title: VEAT - Procurement of Helium
Description:
Helium is a business-critical gas used by SD, particularly as a carrier gas in gas chromatography mass-spectrometry (GC-MS) equipment, a key analytical facility. There are no alternatives to the use of helium in our current equipment. Without a supply of this gas SD will be unable to deliver any work using GC-MS equipment.

Helium is currently in short supply globally, and without helium SD will not be able to conduct any analytical work using GC-MS equipment. This will seriously impact our ability to support HSE in planned and reactive work, our scientific reputation and our ability to earn significant external income from commercial work.
Additional Text:
HSE Has a business-critical need for Helium to be delivered to our Buxton site.

Title: 3367EFM.JR.22 Harper Hills, Buxton - Refurbishment & Remodelling of Bunker 8084
Description:
Dear Sirs,
You are invited to tender for the above titled project. The project comprises the remodelling and refurbishment of Bunker 8084 on behalf of the Department of Civil & Structural Engineering in support of ongoing and future development of The University of Sheffield's site and to provide new blast testing facilities. Bunker 8084 is located at Harpur Hill, Buxton SK17 9JN and accessed via the Health & Safety Executive (HSE). The primary aim of the work package is to remodel the existing bunker to enable the Department to safely undertake experimental explosive research by providing a bespoke blast testing chamber. The works also aim to improve operability, security and thermal performance of the bunker, including refurbishment of existing roof covering and the internal fabric of the bunker. The works are to be delivered in a single section under and are briefly outlined below: 

- Partial demolition of the bunker (including roof mounted structure) to facilitate a new blast chamber.
- Demolition / strip out of internal block walls, FFE and finishes back to the superstructure
- Concrete repairs to structurally safeguard the main superstructure.
- Removal of existing roof covering and provision of new CTF insulated roofing system with guardrails and access facilities
- Internal remodelling to accommodate new Equipment Room, Control Room, Workshop, Firing Range and LV Room.
- Provision of new floor, wall, and ceiling finishes.
- Installation of new Mechanical & Electrical Services to support the above including Fire Alarm and Security Systems.
- Excavate services trenches for M&E services
- Excavation of existing earth banking to enable blast test chamber install

Please note the above list is not exhaustive.

This is a non-EU open tender exercise. The Invitation to Tender (ITT) can be downloaded by registering and expressing your interest on the University`s e-tendering system https://in-tendhost.co.uk/Sheffield. The tender documents provide full information, which will be sent to you once you have expressed your interest. If you have any questions or comments in relation to this tender they must be submitted via the In-tend System, this can be accessed at https://in-tendhost.co.uk/Sheffield. Completed tenders must be returned through the Intend e-tendering system.
Additional Text: All tender documents can be accessed at: https://in-tendhost.co.uk/sheffield

Title: STaRR Cornhill Road St Blazey - Attenuation Features
Description:
The St Austell Bay Resilient Regeneration Project (StARR) aims to work across the whole of the Par and Sandy river catchments to reduce flood risks to communities living and working in the St Austell Bay area, particularly the people of Par and St Blazey. 

Corserv on behalf of Cormac Solutions is seeking to appoint an experienced contractor to provide all necessary resources to carry out the works in accordance with all information contained within this enquiry. The works involves excavation of 5 cross hillside attenuation feature, of which three will be internally divided by check dams due to topography. All these will be unlined storage ponds designed to receive overland flows, which will be retained until the available storage is exceeded, once this occurs exceedance flows will continue on down hillside.
The location of the Rosehill site area Rosehill site area is to the south of Cornhill Road and to the west of the A390 Rosehill Road. The NGR of the approximate centre of the area is SX 06589 54423.

The intention is to award the Contract to the most economically advantageous tenderer based on 30% Quality and 70% Price. 
This project has been part-financed by grant funding from the European Regional Development Fund and will be subject to conditions imposed by the funding body. Suppliers will be expected to comply with the relevant requirements and any associated regulations such as procurement, publicity, and eligibility criteria.

To access the online question template and supporting documents, express an interest and then click the "start my response" button

Title: Help Us, Help You' Creative Development and Production
Description:
The NHS England Campaigns Team deliver national social marketing campaigns to support the NHS. 

Our campaigns are delivered under two overarching campaign brands:
• The 'We are the NHS' campaign aims to inspire people to join the NHS and retain those already working in it. It promotes the NHS as a first-choice employer, focusing on priority recruitment of professions including: Nursing; Allied Health Professionals; Healthcare Support Workers; and 999 & 111 Call Handlers; also supporting the recruitment of NHS Reservists.

• The 'Help Us, Help You' campaign is designed to save lives by changing the way people access services to reduce pressures on the NHS and maintain capacity, by driving effective use of the NHS, encouraging people to get help in the right place and at the right time.

This contract is for an advertising agency to lead the strategy, creative development and production work for the 'Help Us, Help You' campaign.

The 'Help Us, Help You' campaign is delivered through a number of different phases aimed at different audiences and with separate aims and objectives.

All our campaign activity supports the successful delivery of the organisational priorities of NHS England and the wider NHS. These are set out in the NHS Long Term Plan and the annual NHS Priorities and Operational Planning Guidance.
Policy Context: 'Help Us, Help You'

The term is 3+1 years

Title: NHSLA.NAT.365 GMTS Experiential Learning Actors (September 2022 Intake)
Description:
"The Graduate Management Training Scheme (GMTS) modular Experiential Learning Programme is offered as part of a wider package of work-based placement, academic learning and leadership development in support of the development of trainees as leaders of the future in the fields of General Management, Human Resource Management, Finance, Health Analysis, Health Informatics, and Policy & Strategy.  
The Experiential Learning elements of the scheme are delivered by the Academy's Faculty, with all other scheme elements delivered by our University partners.
The Experiential Learning programme is focused on developing the capacity of trainees to explore, enhance, adapt and broaden their own leadership understanding, styles and behaviours in addition to providing them with the necessary skills and tools they need to be effective managers and emerging leaders in their current and future roles. It is delivered as a series of modular residential experiences, offered on a 1, 2 or 3-day basis dependent upon the depth and breadth of the design, content and subject area being explored.  
The specification seeks to put in place the additional Actor-Facilitator requirements across the Experiential Learning modules (outlined below), for the September 2022 cohort, as follows:
LOT 1: Module 1 (actors required on Day 3 of Experiential Learning)
Topic: Getting Started
This is the first experiential learning module participants will have encountered since they started the scheme in September 2022. The module will take place in December 2022, face to face.
Module one has 5 key objectives:

•	To introduce the concept and approach of experiential learning
•	To establish the cohort as a learning community where people know one another and are able to support and challenge each other
•	To increase their understanding of the NHS through 4 different lenses - health policy, equality, diversity & inclusion, front line clinical care and finance
•	To increase their awareness of, and develop skills to increase, personal resilience
•	To increase their personal impact (day three) - this day is where we need actors

The module runs over the course of three days, the first day is focused on understanding
understanding experiential learning, understanding each other and understanding the NHS from the
perspective of health policy EDI. Day two continues the exploration of the NHS through the lenses
of finance and direct clinical care before moving on to considering how they protect and enhance their
personal resilience. The final day is about building practical skills to thrive and survive in the health
and care system, with a focus on increasing their personal impact in the virtual and face to face
environments. Over the course of the three days, they will be working with several different
professionals and in different group sizes.

Organisation Name: THE NATIONAL MUSEUM OF THE ROYAL NAVY
Title: Purchase of Leica RTC360 3D Laser Scanner
Description:
Purchase of Leica RTC360 3D Laser Scanner

Background

1.1.	As part of the conservation project of HMS Victory there will be a significant increase in the requirement to record the ship accurately in 3D. 
1.1.1.	The laser scanner will be used to capture the ship and its elements as they become exposed, throughout the conservation project.
1.1.2.	The resulting point cloud will be modelled, to augment our existing model, to record changes made, both externally and internally.
1.1.3.	The data is required to be accurate to millimetric precision to create a record of the conservation work to the ship, for future generations and also to be compatible with the existing 3D model.
1.1.4.	We completed our own research and also consulted with a professional survey company and we have decided that the Leica RTC360 3D laser scanner will be most suitable for our needs.
1.1.5.	We have had previous 3D laser scans completed using Leica instruments and software and want all of our files to be compatible with each other.
1.1.6.	We own Leica software and total stations, so we are familiar with the Leica interface. 

Objective

2.1.	After research and consulting industry professionals, it was agreed that a Leica RTC360 3D laser scanner is required, which will meet the requirement to be able to record the data for modelling changes to the ship, as well as positioning the resulting point cloud using GPS capability.  
2.2.	Outright purchase of the scanner is required, with the total price given in the tender cost breakdown.  Additional items may be required, if available.  These additional items are also to be priced separately within the tender cost breakdown:
•	A programme compatible with the laser scanner, such as Leica Cyclone REGISTER full version programme;
•	Warranties that cover damage / replacement;
•	Maintenance packages that cover calibration and servicing.

All communications should be sent through tenders@nmrn.org.uk
Contact Address 1: National Museum of the Royal Navy
Contact Address 2: Main Road (PP66), HM Naval Base Portsmouth

Title: Conservation Area Appraisal of the Wednesbury Conservation Area to Include Assessment of Potential for Expansion and Development of Conservation Area Management Plan - AWARD
Description:
The Council is tendering for a contract for the production of a Conservation Area Appraisal for Wednesbury's Market Place conservation area.
      
      The Planning (Listed Buildings and Conservation Areas) Act 1990 places a duty on Local Planning Authorities to consider the designation of Conservation Areas, proposals for their enhancement and their subsequent ongoing management.
      
      Conservation Area Appraisals are a mechanism for reviewing a conservation area designation.  An appraisal should describe the features which make up a conservation area's special character and identify potential for enhancement.
      
      The Council will be using the In-tend e-Tendering System for this Procurement exercise, please visit https://in-tendhost.co.uk/sandwellmbc to access the Sandwell MBC In-tend Supplier Portal.
      
      From here you will be able to register your company, express an interest in the opportunity, and gain immediate access to the Quotation document or other related documents.
      
      In Order To View a On-Line Questionnaire (if applicable) or Submit a Quotation, you will be required to` Opt-In`.   
      
      For a Step by Step user guide to the Sandwell MBC In-tend Supplier Portal please click on the `Guidance for Suppliers` section of the website. All procurement responses must be carried out via the Sandwell MBC In-tend Supplier Portal.  
      
      If you require further assistance in respect of the system please contact the In-tend support team on 0844 272 8810. 
      
      Closing date:  Wednesday 07 September  2022 at 15:00hrs
Supplier [Name|Address|Ref type|Ref Numb: [TDR Heritage Ltd|The Bond, 180-182 Fazeley Street, United Kingdom, B5 5SE|NONE||No|No]
